net.sf.kdgcommons.codec

Class Base64Codec

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.kdgcommons.codec.Codec
      • net.sf.kdgcommons.codec.Base64Codec

  • public class Base64Codec
extends Codec
    Converts binary data to/from a string consisting of base-64 characters.

    There are several standard options for string conversion line breaks, defined by the Base64Codec.Option enum. You can also specify your own breaks and maximum line length.

    Conversion to byte arrays always ignores whitespace, and will also ignore any specified start/end/separation strings (the separation string may appear any where in the source string, the start/end strings must appear in their respective locations).

    Since:
    1.0.14

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Base64Codec.Option
      Different standard construction options: each value specifies a combination of maximum line length and separator characters.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class net.sf.kdgcommons.codec.Codec

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Base64Codec()
      Default constructor; equivalent to Option.UNBROKEN.
      Base64Codec(Base64Codec.Option option)
      Constructs an instance using predefined output configurations.
      Base64Codec(int lineLength, byte[] separator)
      Creates an instance that uses standard encoding, but custom line length and separator.
      Base64Codec(int lineLength, String separator)
      Creates an instance with custom line length and separator, where the separator is specified as a string (and converted via UTF-8).
